metadata.title: CVE-2018-5268 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In OpenCV 3.3.1, a heap-based buffer overflow happens incv::Jpeg2KDecoder::readComponent8u inmodules/imgcodecs/src/grfmt_jpeg2000.cpp when parsing a crafted image file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5268` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopencv-calib3d3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1
libopencv-contrib3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1
libopencv-core3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1
libopencv-features2d3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1
libopencv-flann3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1
libopencv-highgui3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1
libopencv-imgcodecs3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1
libopencv-imgproc3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1
libopencv-ml3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1
libopencv-objdetect3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1
libopencv-photo3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1
libopencv-shape3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1
libopencv-stitching3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1
libopencv-superres3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1
libopencv-video3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1
libopencv-videoio3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1
libopencv-videostab3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1
libopencv-viz3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1
libopencv3.2-java - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1
libopencv3.2-jni - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1
opencv-data - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1
python-opencv - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1
python3-opencv - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: opencv package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1').
